title: Flagging aducust records using `aducust_flag`
text: rootnum — child ID variable dob — randomly selected set DOBs class Date. 100 children simulated Now previewing first rows: rootnum dob 4ONCNY 2017-01-26 Z0E01I 2019-12-05 28HZGI 2014-09-29 S9NQLO 2016-02-20 5GIJW0 2016-11-12 G05Y72 2015-01-28 EHLMR6 2017-03-08 0YUOZ4 2018-08-15 P3FHVV 2012-09-24 4Q7DME 2014-08-09
code: # Function to create unique random rootnums make_rootnum <- function(n){   replicate(n, paste0(sample(c(LETTERS, 0:9), 6, replace = TRUE), collapse = ""))   }  # Formulate rootnums n_children <- 100  rootnums <- make_rootnum(n_children)  # dobmap: rootnum + dob dobmap <- tibble(rootnum = rootnums,                  dob = as.Date('2010-01-01') + sample(0:3650, n_children, replace = TRUE)) head(dobmap, n = 10) %>%   waachs_table()

title: Flagging aducust records using `aducust_flag`
text: rootnum — child ID variable. Necessary multiple carers per child. Must called something different child ID variable (.e., called rootnum). individual can number carers associated . Now previewing first rows: rootnum carer_type carer_rootnum 4ONCNY NEWBMID 23ANG7JO 4ONCNY carer2id SRVRCRAO Z0E01I carer2id F6J7ZRE8 28HZGI NEWBMID F2IVT3N2 28HZGI carer1id KTQXYMLF S9NQLO carer1id C1KSK9VK 5GIJW0 NEWBMID 0BF912DE 5GIJW0 carer1id 4IS1OK2Q G05Y72 carer2id YLSGKOIX G05Y72 NEWBMID SK6IWQJH
code: carer_types <- c("carer1id", "carer2id", "NEWBMID")  # For each child, randomly assign 1 to 3 carers carers_per_child <- sample(1:3, n_children, replace = TRUE)  # Create carer_map rows by repeating rootnum as per carers_per_child carer_map <- tibble(rootnum = rep(rootnums, times = carers_per_child)) %>%   mutate(carer_type = sample(carer_types, n(), replace = TRUE)) %>%   distinct(rootnum, carer_type) %>%   # Use unique random alphanumeric strings for carer_rootnum (no prefix)   mutate(carer_rootnum = replicate(n(), paste0(sample(c(LETTERS, 0:9), 8, replace = TRUE), collapse = ""))) head(carer_map, n = 10) %>%   waachs_table()

title: Flagging aducust records using `aducust_flag`
text: Carer ID variable name must equivalent carer_map aducust. ReceptionDate — aducust start date. DischargeDate — aducust end date. carer can number aducust records (range 0-10). Discharge date must reception date. Now previewing first rows: carer_rootnum ReceptionDate DischargeDate 23ANG7JO 2020-04-20 2020-05-01 23ANG7JO 2020-11-20 2020-12-19 23ANG7JO 2020-01-18 2020-01-21 23ANG7JO 2022-09-10 2022-09-21 23ANG7JO 2020-05-21 2020-06-08 23ANG7JO 2022-08-26 2022-09-25 23ANG7JO 2022-01-03 2022-01-23 23ANG7JO 2022-06-06 2022-06-12 23ANG7JO 2022-01-02 2022-01-03 23ANG7JO 2021-11-26 2021-12-02
code: # data: multiple aducust records per carer_rootnum with start/end dates # Initialize empty list to store records aducust_list <- vector("list", length = nrow(carer_map))  for (i in seq_len(nrow(carer_map))) {   n_records <- sample(0:10, 1)    if (n_records == 0) {     aducust_list[[i]] <- NULL   } else {     rec_dates <- as.Date('2020-01-01') + sample(0:1000, n_records, replace = TRUE)     dis_dates <- rec_dates + sample(1:30, n_records, replace = TRUE)      aducust_list[[i]] <- tibble(       rootnum = carer_map$carer_rootnum[i],  # carer_rootnum as requested       ReceptionDate = rec_dates,       DischargeDate = dis_dates     )   }   rm(i, n_records, rec_dates, dis_dates) }  # Combine all rows into one dataframe aducust <- bind_rows(aducust_list) %>%   rename(carer_rootnum = rootnum) head(aducust, n = 10) %>%   waachs_table()

title: Using `WAACHShelp::icd_morb_flag` in practice
text: bulk function’s flexibility lies. present couple examples, compared help package. involves specifying flag_category = "", specifying diagnosis type (diag_type) search across. diag_type can take 4 distinct values "prinicipal diagnosis" – Search across principal diagnosis variable (morbidity data must contain diag represents principal diagnosis field). "additional diagnoses" – Search across additional diagnoses variables (morbidity data must contain ediag1–ediag20 represent additional diagnosis fields). "external cause injury" – Search across external cause injury variables (morbidity data must contain ecode1–ecode4 represent external cause injury fields). "custom" – !

text: Let’s re-create MH_morb flag manual flagging.

title: Using `WAACHShelp::icd_morb_flag` in practice
text: must specify boundaries search across “principal diagnosis”, “additional diagnoses”, “external cause injury” variable groups. fed diag_type_custom_params argument. data structure must list lists. list lists must search keys equal “letter” (letter ICD code, empty string strictly numeric), “lower” (lower bound numeric element), “upper” (upper bound numeric element).
code: icd_morb_flag(data = morb_dat,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = c("principal diagnosis", "additional diagnoses", "external cause of injury"),               diag_type_custom_params = list("principal diagnosis" = list(list(letter = "F",                                                                                 lower = 0,                                                                                 upper = 99.9999),                                                                           list(letter = "" ,                                                                                 lower = 290,                                                                                 upper = 319.9999)),                                              "additional diagnoses" = list(list(letter = "F",                                                                                  lower = 0,                                                                                  upper = 99.9999),                                                                            list(letter = "",                                                                                  lower = 290,                                                                                  upper = 319.9999)),                                              "external cause of injury" = list(list(letter = "E",                                                                                      lower = 950,                                                                                      upper = 959.9999),                                                                                list(letter = "X",                                                                                      lower = 60,                                                                                      upper = 84.9999))),               flag_other_varname = "MH_morb_custom")

previous_headings: Flagging > Manual flagging > Example 1: Basic flag creation
title: Using `WAACHShelp::icd_morb_flag` in practice
text: specific example little (lot) tedious, still proceed illustrative purposes. instance, must individually specify search parameters every variable. Therefore, must set diag_type="custom", name variables like search across using diag_type_custom_vars argument.
code: # Set search parameters for principal, additional diagnoses diag_ediag_params <- list(list(letter = "F",                                 lower = 0,                                 upper = 99.9999),                           list(letter = "" ,                                 lower = 290,                                 upper = 319.9999))  # Set search parameters for ecode variables ecode_params <- list(list(letter = "E",                            lower = 950,                            upper = 959.9999),                      list(letter = "X",                            lower = 60,                            upper = 84.9999))   icd_morb_flag(data = morb_dat,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = "custom",               diag_type_custom_vars = c("diag",                # Principal diagnosis variables                                         paste0("ediag", 1:20), # Additional diagnosis variables                                         paste0("ecode", 1:4)   # External cause of injury variables                                         ),               diag_type_custom_params = list("diag" = diag_ediag_params,                                              setNames(rep(list(diag_ediag_params), 20), paste0("ediag", 1:20)),                                              setNames(rep(list(ecode_params), 20), paste0("ecode", 1:4))),               flag_other_varname = "MH_morb_custom")

title: Using `WAACHShelp::icd_morb_flag` in practice
text: can flexibly specify diag_type—can search across pre-defined group (principal diagnosis, additional diagnoses, external cause injury) addition (set ) custom variable(s). example, like search across additional diagnoses variables, addition variable named dagger, can :
code: icd_morb_flag(data = morb_dat,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = c("additional diagnoses", "custom"),               diag_type_custom_vars = "dagger",               diag_type_custom_params = list("additional diagnoses" = diag_ediag_params,                                              "dagger" = diag_ediag_params),               flag_other_varname = "MH_morb_custom")

text: function serves flag whether custodial record exists child certain stage.

title: Custodial data flagging function — aducust_flag
code: aducust_flag(   data,   dobmap,   carer_map,   flag_name = "carer_aducust",   child_id_var = "rootnum",   carer_id_var = "carer_rootnum",   data_start_date = "ReceptionDate",   data_end_date = "DischargeDate",   dobmap_dob_var = "dob",   child_start_age = 0,   child_end_age = 18,   carer_summary = FALSE,   any_carer_summary = FALSE )

title: Custodial data flagging function — aducust_flag
text: data Input dataset (carer aducust). dobmap DOBmap file child level. carer_map Mapping file columns "child ID", "carer ID". Can multiple rows per child (e.g., one per carer 1, carer 2, NEWBMID). flag_name Name flagging variable return. Default "carer_aducust". child_id_var Variable denoting "child ID". Must exist called thing dobmap carer_map. Default "rootnum". carer_id_var Variable denoting "carer ID". Must exist carer_map. Default "carer_rootnum". data_start_date Start date consider data. Corresponds aducust start date. Default "ReceptionDate". data_end_date End date consider data. Corresponds aducust end date. Default "DischargeDate". dobmap_dob_var Date birth (DOB) variable dobmap. Default "dob". child_start_age Numeric. Start (minimum) age (years) consider flagging (default 0). child_end_age Numeric. End (maximum) age (years) consider flagging (default 18). carer_summary Collapse aducust flags within carer (.e., carer_id_var). Default FALSE. any_carer_summary Collapse aducust flags across carers. Default FALSE.

text: function serves add flags input data set (morbidity stage) pursuant ICD codes. Flags can added general categories based pre-established ICD codes (e.g., mental health contact, substance-related contact, alcohol/tobacco-related contact etc.) add custom set ICD codes. file pre-established ICD codes saved .RData file trivial change.

title: ICD flagging function — icd_morb_flag
code: icd_morb_flag(   data,   dobmap = NULL,   flag_category,   flag_other_varname,   diag_type,   diag_type_custom_vars = NULL,   diag_type_custom_params,   under_age = FALSE,   age = 18,   person_summary = FALSE,   id_var = "rootnum",   morb_date_var = "subadm",   dobmap_dob_var = "dob",   dobmap_other_vars = NULL )

title: ICD flagging function — icd_morb_flag
text: data Input dataset (morbidity). dobmap DOBmap file corresponding input dataset. flag_category Type flag generate. Takes values reference file (e.g., MH_morb, Sub_morb, etc.) "" custom ICD specification flagging. flag_other_varname Flag variable name (specified flag_category == ""). Input character string. diag_type Diagnosis type. Select "principal diagnosis", () "additional diagnoses", "external cause injury", "custom". diag_type_custom_vars Variables search across diag_type == "custom". diag_type_custom_params Search parameters search across diag_type == "custom". Must list keys variable names values inputs WAACHShelp::val_filt. Can also list lists multiple ICD can searched across single variable. See examples specification. under_age Return additional variables corresponding participant strictly age y.o.. Uses DOBmap DOB subadm morbidity admission date. Variables suffix "_under{age}". age Numeric. Age (years) consider under_age variable (default 18). person_summary Summarise results person-level. id_var Joining (ID) variable consistent data dobmap. Default rootnum. morb_date_var Hospital morbidity date variable data. Default "subadm". dobmap_dob_var Date birth (DOB) variable dobmap. Default "dob". dobmap_other_vars variables carry across DOBmap file joining data. Default NULL. Can vector strings.

title: ICD flagging function — icd_morb_flag
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example 1: Basic use ## Create any mental health or substance-related morbidity flag, "MH_morb" ## Searches "principal diagnosis", "additional diagnoses", "external cause of injury". ## Create additional flag for whether admission occurred when under 18 years of age icd_morb_flag(   data = morb,   dobmap = dob,   flag_category = "MH_morb",   under_age = T,   age = 18,   dobmap_other_vars = c("xyz123", "abc456") # Also join `xyz123`, `abc456` from DOBmap   )  # Example 2: Basic use ## Create any substance-related morbidity flag, "Sub_morb" icd_morb_flag(data = morb,               flag_category = "Sub_morb" # Create any MH contact flag               )  # Example 3: Search  *principal diagnosis* and *first additional diagnosis* # for a custom set of ICD codes ## Call this variable "test_var" icd_morb_flag(data = morb,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = "custom",               diag_type_custom_vars = c("diagnosis", "ediag20"),               diag_type_custom_params = list("diagnosis" = list("letter" = "F",                                                                 "lower" = 0,                                                                 "upper" = 99.9999),                                              "ediag20" = list("letter" = "",                                                               "lower" = 0,                                                               "upper" = 99.9999)),               flag_other_varname = "test_var"               )  # Example 4: # Search only across primary diagnosis and # (all) additional diagnosis fields for a custom set of ICD codes. ## Call this variable "test_var2" icd_morb_flag(data = morb,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = c("principal diagnosis", "additional diagnoses"),               diag_type_custom_params = list("principal diagnosis" = list("letter" = "F",                                                                           "lower" = 0,                                                                           "upper" = 99.9999),                                              "additional diagnoses" = list("letter" = "",                                                                            "lower" = 0,                                                                            "upper" = 99.9999)),               flag_other_varname = "test_var2"               )  # Example 5: Search across (all) additional diagnosis fields and another random field, `dagger` ## Call this variable "test_var3" icd_morb_flag(data = morb,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = c("custom", "additional diagnoses"),               diag_type_custom_vars = "dagger",               diag_type_custom_params = list("dagger" = list("letter" = "F",                                                              "lower" = 0,                                                              "upper" = 99.9999)),               flag_other_varname = "test_var3"               )  # Example 6: Searching across multiple ICD code types within a variable ## Call this variable "test_var4" -- replicating MH_morb flag icd_morb_flag(data = morb,               flag_category = "Other",               diag_type = c("additional diagnoses",                             "additional diagnoses",                             "external cause of injury"),               flag_other_varname = "test_var3",               diag_type_custom_params =               list("principal diagnosis" = list(list("letter" = "F",                                                      "lower" = 0,                                                      "upper" = 99.9999),                                                 list("letter" = "",                                                      "lower" = 290,                                                      "upper" = 319.9999)),                     "additional diagnoses" = list(list("letter" = "F",                                                        "lower" = 0,                                                        "upper" = 99.9999),                                                   list("letter" = "",                                                        "lower" = 290,                                                        "upper" = 319.9999)),                     "external cause of injury" = list(list("letter" = "E",                                                            "lower" = 950,                                                            "upper" = 959.9999),                                                       list("letter" = "X",                                                            "lower" = 60,                                                            "upper" = 84.9999)))) } # }

title: WAACHS colour palette — waachs_palette
text: type Type colour palette render (values "discrete", "continuous"). n Number colours generate palette (type == "continuous"). visualisation (Default TRUE). Return visualisation colour spectrum aid decision making. bias positive number representing spacing colours high end. Parsed grDevices::colorRamp (default 2). interpolate Interpolation algorithm parse grDevices::colorRamp (default "spline"). ... Miscellaneous arguments parse grDevices::colorRampPalette.

title: WAACHS table formatting function. — waachs_table

title: WAACHS table formatting function. — waachs_table
code: waachs_table(   x,   font.size = 10,   font.size.header = 11,   line.spacing = 1.5,   padding = 2.5,   body_bg_col = "#FEF0D8",   header_bg_col = "#89A1AD",   header_text_col = "black",   highlight = NULL,   highlight_darken = 0.3,   font_family = "Barlow",   ... )

title: WAACHS table formatting function. — waachs_table
text: x table, typically data.frame, tibble, output gtsummary. font.size font size text body table, defaults 8 (passed set_flextable_defaults). font.size.header font size text header table, defaults 10. line.spacing Line spacing table, defaults 1.5 (passed set_flextable_defaults). padding Padding around four sides text within cell, defaults 2 (passed set_flextable_defaults). body_bg_col Body background colour (default WAACHS cream). header_bg_col Header background colour (default WAACHS blue). header_text_col Header text colour (default black). highlight numeric vector specifying rows highlight. highlight_darken numeric value specifying amount body_bg_col "darkened" (tinted) (default 0.3). font_family Font family plot (default Barlow). ... arguments parsed flextable::set_flextable_defaults.
